episodes.title: LA28 chair Wasserman to sell agency amid Epstein fallout
episodes.description:
Casey Wasserman, the Los Angeles entertainment executive leading preparations for the 2028 Olympic Games, plans to sell his talent agency following mounting backlash tied to newly released documents connected to convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein. Details: https://ktla.com/local-news/la28-chair-casey-wasserman-to-sell-talent-agency-amid-epstein-fallout/

Watch KTLA streaming live on the free KTLA+ app for Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV and Samsung Smart TVs: https://ktla.com/watch-ktla-on-roku-apple-tv-amazon-fire-tv/

episodes.title: L.A. Olympic committee stands by Casey Wasserman amid Epstein files backlash
episodes.description:
Los Angeles’ Olympic organizing committee LA28 is standing by its chairman, Casey Wasserman, who’s facing backlash after a series of racy emails exchanged with convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell were released as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

Watch KTLA streaming live on the free KTLA+ app for Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV and Samsung Smart TVs: https://ktla.com/watch-ktla-on-roku-apple-tv-amazon-fire-tv/

episodes.title: Leaders, members of cult-like religious group in Southern California appear in court
episodes.description:
Leaders and members of His Way Spirit Led Assemblies, a cult-like religious group out of the Inland Empire in Southern California, made an appearance in court Thursday as they face charges of murder and more. “They were a church cult – whatever they called themselves. They kept me locked away because I knew what they were doing was wrong, like beating me every day," a former member said. KTLA's Shelby Nelson reports on Feb. 5, 2026.

Details: https://ktla.com/news/local-news/former-members-of-cult-like-group-in-california-detail-years-of-torture-starvation-and-alleged-murder/

Watch KTLA streaming live on the free KTLA+ app for Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV and Samsung Smart TVs: https://ktla.com/watch-ktla-on-roku-apple-tv-amazon-fire-tv/

episodes.title: Former members of cult-like group in SoCal recall years of torture, starvation
episodes.description:
“They were a church cult – whatever they called themselves. They kept me locked away because I knew what they were doing was wrong, like beating me every day.” KTLA's Mary Beth McDade reports on Feb. 3, 2026.

episodes.title: DOJ says less than 1% of the Epstein files have been released
episodes.description:
U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) officials disclosed that more than 99% percent of the materials related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have not yet been released, with over two million documents reportedly "in various phases of review and redaction.”

Details: https://time.com/7343702/epstein-files-release-doj/

Watch KTLA streaming live on the free KTLA+ app for Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV and Samsung Smart TVs: https://ktla.com/watch-ktla-on-roku-apple-tv-amazon-fire-tv/

episodes.title: Police reopen case of 4-year-old's death
episodes.description:
Police in Colton, California are pursuing new leads in the case of a child who died after his parents relinquished custody to a religious sect that is currently under investigation for possible homicide involving a former member. KTLA's Mary Beth McDade reports. Aug. 28, 2025.

KTLA 5 News - Keeping Southern Californians informed since 1947.

episodes.title: Leaders of cult-like California religious group arrested after ex-member's disappearance
episodes.description:
The alleged husband and wife in charge of the cult-like religious organization connected to a man's disappearance in the Inland Empire two years ago have been arrested, though the "prophetess" was released due to what police called a "medical episode."

Kareen Wynter reports for the KTLA 5 News at Noon on Aug. 27, 2025. 

Details: https://ktla.com/news/local-news/leaders-of-cult-like-california-religious-group-arrested-after-ex-members-disappearance/

KTLA 5 News - Keeping Southern Californians informed since 1947.

episodes.title: Search warrants tied to home in Netflix docuseries
episodes.description:
A large operation was seen unfolding in Tujunga on Friday morning when federal and local law enforcement served a search warrant for multiple crime allegations, including, most notably, sex trafficking, at a home that property records show is owned by a controversial pastor and accused cult leader. KTLA's Kimberly Cheng reports on July 25, 2025. Details: https://ktla.com/news/local-news/sex-trafficking-warrant-served-at-l-a-home-owned-by-alleged-tiktok-cult-pastor/

KTLA 5 News - Keeping Southern Californians informed since 1947.
